intro: Weinmannia jelskii, commonly known as the Jelskii's weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the arid regions of southern South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, narrow leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
